entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 5.5.25
entry.summary: Melrose Elementary School 5th grader Cole Stark is a national finalist in the Future Chefs National Challenge. He is joined by Sodexo at Schools Roseburg Public Schools General Manager Loran Perry to talk about the competition. Voting for Cole can be done once a day through Friday at: https://futurechefschallenge.com/

entry.title: Plant and Garden Expo brings good times and green thumbs to Roseburg
entry.summary: On Saturday, horticulture enthusiasts came out in droves to the Douglas County Fairgrounds to purchase gardening goods at the Douglas County Master Gardener Association's (DCMGA) Plant and Garden Expo.

entry.title: Cole Stark reaches national heights with meatloaf
entry.summary: Cole Stark made asian meatloaf with cilantro lime rice and cilantro lime crema reach the national level.

entry.title: Dowdy indicted for fatal crash with UCC softball bus
entry.summary: Johnathan Dowdy, 32, was arraigned on 25 charges in a crash that killed two UCC softball players and injured eight others. He remains in jail on $2 million bail. Prosecutors allege reckless driving with extreme indifference. His next court date is set for May 21.

The previous warmest high temperature for 2025 was 84 degrees, set...

entry.title: ROSEBURG WITH BELOW NORMAL RAIN FOR APRIL, ABOVE NORMAL FOR WATER YEAR
entry.summary: May 2, 2025 4:10 a.m. Roseburg saw below normal rainfall for the month of April but is still above the normal amount for the water year. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said the Roseburg Regional Airport measured 0.76 inches of rain last month. The normal amount for April is 2.71 inches, meaning Roseburg was...
